metadata.title: PTA Prompt and Requirements Package (Rev 4)
metadata.purpose: Guide an LLM (e.g., GitHub Copilot) to generate a complete Privacy Threshold Agreement (PTA) for a specified VBMS system, prioritizing VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml, ensuring accurate data, minimizing steward input, and embedding initiator signature (AMBoserup).
metadata.usage: Upload this JSON with VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml. Prompt the steward for the target system, confirm artifact URLs, extract data, and generate a complete PTA in .txt format.
sources: System Architecture Confluence page (URL or PDF)
System steward input (only for critical missing data)
metadata.wip_status: Work in Progress, updated to fix incomplete output, incorrect data, and PacMan misuse

instructions.overview: You are an LLM (e.g., GitHub Copilot) tasked with generating a complete Privacy Threshold Agreement (PTA) for a specified VBMS system, adhering to the FY25 Standard PTA Template. Prompt the steward for the target system, validate it against VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml, extract data from XML/Confluence/GitHub/partial drafts, use VBMSC examples for gaps, and minimize steward input. Complete all sections, embedding the initiator’s signature (AMBoserup).

guardrails.description: Prompt for the target system and validate against VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml. If invalid, provide a list of valid systems (e.g., Package Manager (PacMan), VBMS Correspondence).
Extract system-specific data (e.g., eMASS ID, POCs, program office) from VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml first, then cross-check with Confluence, GitHub, and partial PTA drafts.
Lock data extraction to the selected system’s XML entry. Log and prompt if non-system data (e.g., PacMan for VBMS Correspondence) is detected.
Extract all data from XML (e.g., POCs, eMASS ID), Confluence (architecture, connections), GitHub (tech stack, data models), and partial PTA drafts before prompting.
Generate a full PTA with sections 1–3, Review, and Signatures, using placeholders for unresolvable fields. Verify completeness before output.
Batch prompts for missing data (e.g., PIA approval date, contact emails) into one request per section. Use XML defaults to avoid unnecessary prompts.
Prompts include VBMSC PTA examples, source suggestions (e.g., 'Check XML POCs'), and review instructions for placeholders.

initiation.description: Prompt for the target system and confirm/provide artifact URLs.

prompts.text: Please specify the VBMS system for the PTA (e.g., 'Package Manager (PacMan)', 'VBMS Correspondence').
prompts.validation: Validate against VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml. If invalid, prompt: 'System not found. Please select from: Package Manager (PacMan), VBMS Correspondence, Document Generator, etc.'

prompts.text: Confirm or provide the System Architecture Confluence page URL (e.g., https://confluence.devops.va.gov/display/VAExternal/2993_Package+Manager+Architecture) or upload a PDF export.
prompts.validation: If inaccessible, prompt: 'Confluence URL is invalid. Provide a valid URL or PDF export.'

prompts.text: Confirm or provide the GitHub repository URL (e.g., https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-pacman-service).
prompts.validation: If invalid, prompt: 'GitHub URL is invalid. Provide a valid repository URL.'

prompts.text: Provide any partial PTA draft or additional documentation (e.g., PTA_Package_Manager_FY25.txt, architecture diagrams) as URLs or files (.txt, .pdf).

process_flow.description: Validate the selected system against VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml. Extract system-specific data (e.g., eMASS ID, POCs, program office).
Extract additional data from Confluence (architecture, connections), GitHub (tech stack, data models), and partial PTA drafts. Cross-check for consistency and log discrepancies.
For missing data, use XML defaults or VBMSC PTA examples, marking as 'place holder (review required)'. Batch prompts for critical gaps (e.g., contact emails, PIA approval date).
Generate a complete PTA in .txt format, including all sections, initiator’s signature (AMBoserup), placeholders with review instructions, and a review checklist.

input_guidelines.validation: Ensure URLs are accessible and files are machine-readable. Use VA-approved environments for sensitive data (e.g., PII, PHI).
input_guidelines.prompt_handling: Batch prompts into one request per section. Include VBMSC PTA examples and source suggestions (e.g., 'Check XML POCs').

output_format.description: Generate a .txt file with the complete PTA, structured per the FY25 Standard PTA Template. Include all sections, initiator’s signature (AMBoserup), placeholders with review instructions, and a review checklist.
output_format.example_structure:
# Privacy Threshold Agreement (PTA)
## 1 - Information System and Project Information
1.1 Date: [Filled]
...
## Approval Signatures
Initiator: AMBoserup
...
## Review Checklist
- Verify placeholders
- Coordinate signatures

troubleshooting.solution: Prompt with a list of valid systems from VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml.
Prompt for PDF exports or GitHub files (e.g., README.md).
Use XML defaults or VBMSC PTA examples, mark as 'place holder (review required)', and list in the review checklist.
Log mismatch and prompt: 'Data for [system] detected for [selected_system]. Confirm correct system.'
Verify all sections are generated, using placeholders if necessary. Cross-check with FY25 template.

fields.name: Date PTA Submitted to PIA Support for Review
fields.prompt: Confirm the PTA submission date (default: 2025-05-21, e.g., 4/12/2025).

fields.name: Name of the IT System or Project
fields.prompt: System name extracted as [system_name]. Confirm or provide correct name (e.g., Package Manager (PacMan)).

fields.name: Former System Name (from Last PTA)
fields.prompt: Confirm the former system name (default: N/A).

fields.name: eMASS ID #
fields.prompt: Confirm the eMASS ID (default: [emass_id], e.g., 2061). Check XML or Confluence.

fields.name: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Usage
fields.prompt: Confirm if the system uses AI (default: False). Check Confluence architecture or GitHub code.

fields.name: VA Administration/Offices Processing the PTA
fields.prompt: Confirm the VA administration (default: [administration], e.g., VBA). Options: VHA, VBA, NCA, VACO.

fields.name: Data Owners in This System
fields.prompt: Confirm data owners (default: [data_owners], e.g., VBA: List of VBA Offices). Specify offices if known.

fields.name: Program Office
fields.prompt: Confirm the program office (default: [program_office], e.g., Compensation and Pension).

fields.name: System Ownership/Control
fields.prompt: Confirm the ownership model (default: [ownership_control], e.g., VA Owned and VA Operated). Options: VA Partnership, VA Owned and VA Operated, VA Owned and non-VA Operated, VA Controlled / non-VA Owned and Operated.

fields.name: IT System and Project Contacts

default.title: Information System Owner
default.name: Extract from VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml (POCs)
default.email: Extract from VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml or place holder (review required)

fields.prompt: Provide contact details for Privacy Officer, ISSO, ISO, and Data Owner (e.g., Privacy Officer: Marvis Harvey, Marvis.Harvey@va.gov, 314-964-5469). XML POCs: [list POCs]. Check VA directory or Confluence. Default: place holder (review required).

fields.name: Status of IT System and Project
fields.prompt: Confirm status (default: Existing with PIA) and provide PIA approval date (e.g., 6/1/2022). Options: New, Existing without PIA, Existing with PIA, Decommissioned, Non-operational.

fields.name: System Categorization
fields.prompt: Confirm categorization (default: Minor, augmenting VBMS, eMASS ID 1021). Provide major system details if different.

fields.name: Type of Model Used
fields.prompt: Confirm the service model (default: Not Applicable). Options: SaaS, PaaS, IaaS, DaaS, MBaaS, ITMaaS, Not Applicable.

fields.name: Type of Information Contained
fields.prompt: Confirm if VA data is processed (default: Yes).

fields.name: PII Confidentiality Impact Level
fields.prompt: Confirm the PII impact level (default: Moderate). Options: Low, Moderate, High.

requirements.condition: Skip if new PTA or decommissioned

fields.name: Annual Validation Status
fields.description: Major changes or PIA update status.

example.status: No major changes but PIA needs update

fields.prompt: Confirm validation status (default: No major changes). Options: Major changes, No major changes, No major changes but PIA needs update. Provide change details if applicable.

fields.name: System Description
fields.default: Extract from Confluence overview, GitHub README, or Partial PTA draft; otherwise, use VBMSC example
fields.example: The Package Manager Service is a component of the Veterans Benefits Management System (VBMS) responsible for managing, orchestrating, and processing packages of documents and data related to veterans’ benefits claims...
fields.prompt: Confirm the system description (default: [extracted description]). Edit if needed, referencing Confluence overview or GitHub README.

fields.name: Technologies Employed
fields.prompt: Confirm technologies (default: Cloud Computing). Options: Cloud Computing, Web Portal Internal, Web Portal External, SharePoint, Closed Circuit TV, Social Media, Mobile Devices/Applications, Applications, Robotic Process Automation, Other, Not Applicable. Check XML tenant apps or GitHub tech stack.

fields.name: Data Stored in the Cloud
fields.prompt: Confirm if data is stored in the cloud (default: True).

fields.name: Cloud Service Provider Details
fields.prompt: Confirm cloud provider details (default: VAEC AWS Government, placeholder contract). Provide actual contract number if known.

fields.name: Collection of Individual Information
fields.prompt: Confirm if individual information is collected (default: True).

fields.name: PII/PHI Data Collected
fields.prompt: Confirm PII/PHI data elements (default: Veterans: Claimant Name, SSN, etc.). Check Confluence data types or GitHub data models.

fields.name: Retrieval by Unique Identifier
fields.description: Whether data is retrieved by unique identifier.
fields.prompt: Confirm if data is retrieved by unique identifier (default: True, e.g., SSN).

fields.name: Existing SORN

sorn_details.title: Compensation, Pension, Education, and Vocational Rehabilitation and Employment Records-VA
Compensation, Pension, Education, and Vocational Rehabilitation and Employment Records-VA

fields.prompt: Confirm SORN details (default: 58VA21, Compensation Records, no update needed). Check VA OPRM site or Confluence compliance.

fields.name: Direct Collection from Individuals
fields.description: Whether data is collected directly from individuals.
fields.prompt: Confirm if data is collected directly from individuals (default: False).

fields.name: SSN Collection
fields.prompt: Confirm if SSNs are collected (default: True, alternative: ICN, EDIPI).

fields.name: SSN Privacy Enhancing Technologies
fields.prompt: Confirm SSN protection technologies (default: Encrypted, Only available to certain users). Options: Encrypted, Anonymized, Truncated, Partial form, Hidden from all users, Only available to certain users, Not applicable.

fields.name: Internal PII Sharing
fields.prompt: Confirm if PII is shared internally (default: True).

fields.name: Internal Components Table

default.component_name: Extract from VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml (tenant_apps) or place holder (review required)

example.component_name: Database names not identified in VBMS application interconnection

fields.prompt: Confirm component names sharing PII (default: [tenant_apps or placeholder]). Confirm data elements (e.g., Claimant Name, SSN). Check XML tenant apps or GitHub data models.

fields.name: Internal VA Sharing

example.transmission_method: Specific signing, encryption, and SAML injection techniques

fields.prompt: Confirm internal systems and transmission method (default: VBMS Core, SAML encryption). Provide details if different.

fields.name: External PII/PHI Sharing
fields.prompt: Confirm if PII/PHI is shared externally (default: False).

fields.name: External Data Sharing Table
fields.prompt: Provide external systems sharing PII/PHI (default: N/A). Include connection and agreement types if applicable.

requirements.note: Completed by PIA Support, but include defaults for steward review.

fields.name: Date Reviewed by VA PIA Support Analyst
fields.prompt: Provide the review date, if known (e.g., 4/17/2025). Default: place holder (review required).

fields.name: Name of VA PIA Support Analyst
fields.prompt: Provide the analyst’s name, if known (e.g., Bertha Okere-Ford). Default: place holder (review required).

fields.name: VA PIA Support Analyst Signature
fields.prompt: Leave blank for PIA Support.

fields.name: Determination

default.comments: System processes PII, requires PIA update (place holder (review required))

fields.prompt: Confirm privacy sensitivity (default: True, PIA update needed). Provide comments if known.

fields.name: PIA Support Analyst Comments
fields.default: The [system_name] is a privacy-sensitive system processing PII for Veterans and dependents. A PIA update is required (place holder (review required)).
fields.example: The VBMS Correspondence is a privacy sensitive system that collects, maintains, and/or processes Personally Identifiable Information on Veterans and/or dependents...
fields.prompt: Provide analyst comments, if known (e.g., PII processing details). Default: placeholder (review required).

fields.name: Approval Signatures
fields.prompt: Provide signatures for Privacy Officer, ISSO, and ISO (e.g., Privacy Officer: Digitally signed by Marvis Harvey). Initiator signature (AMBoserup) included. Coordinate with XML POCs ([list POCs]) or VA directory.

review_checklist: Verify all 'place holder (review required)' fields (e.g., POCs, SORN details, PIA approval date) using VBMS_Architecture_Dependency.xml, Confluence, GitHub, or VA directory.
Confirm PII/PHI data elements are consistent across tables (3.4.1, 3.9a.1, 3.9b).
Coordinate signatures for Privacy Officer, ISSO, and ISO via VA directory or XML POCs.
Submit to VA PIA Support (piasupport@va.gov) with signed PDF, ensuring analyst signature is included.
